Class ManagementSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • ManagementSystem

  • public class ManagementSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a basic hotel management system that allows you to log-in, book rooms, cancel books as guests and book rooms, cancel books, check-ins and checkouts as receptionist. Store information of guests, receptionists and room informations in a csv file.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<User> guestLoginInfo
      An array list of User for storing the regular user informations.
      private java.util.ArrayList<HotelRoom> hotelRooms
      An array list of Rooms for storing the room informations.
      private java.util.ArrayList<User> recepLoginInfo
      An array list of User for storing the receptionist informations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ManagementSystem​(java.lang.String roomFile, java.lang.String userFile)
      2 Parameter constructor that takes 2 csv file names that holds room and user informations.

      Parses the given csv file that holds Log-in informations and stores them in 'recepLoginInfo, guestLoginInfo'

      • guestCancelBook

        private boolean guestCancelBook​(User user,
                                int roomNo)
                         throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        This method allows you to cancel your book.
        Parameters:
        user - Guest who's gonna cancel the book.
        roomNo - HotelRoom number.
        Returns:
        Returns true if Canceling was successful.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - Throws exception if guestID doesn't match or roomNo is invalid.

      • recepCancelBook

        private boolean recepCancelBook​(User user,
                                int guestID,
                                int roomNo)
                         throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        This method allows receptionist to cancel the book.
        Parameters:
        user - Guest who's gonna cancel the book.
        guestID - Guest's ID who booked the room.
        roomNo - HotelRoom number.
        Returns:
        Returns true if Canceling was successful.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - Throws exception if guestID doesn't match or roomNo is invalid.

                              int guestID,
                              int roomNo)
                       throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        This method allows receptionist to book rooms.
        Parameters:
        user - Receptionist who books the room.
        guestID - Guest's ID who wants to book the room.
        roomNo - HotelRoom number.
        Returns:
        Returns true if booking was successful.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - Throws exception if guestID doesn't match or roomNo is invalid.

        Parameters:

        guestID - Guest's ID who wants to check-in.
        roomNo - HotelRoom number.
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • saveData

        private void saveData​(java.lang.String roomCSV,
                      java.lang.String userCSV)
               throws java.security.InvalidParameterException,
                      java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Saves HotelRoom and user informations under given file names. Please not that those files must be csv file.
        Parameters:
        roomCSV - csv file that will hold room informations.
        userCSV - csv file that will hold user informations.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - Throws InvalidParameterException if file format is not csv.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Throws FileNotFoundException if the file doesn't exist

        Returns:
        1 for True, 0 for False.
